newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Defiance recommends accepting Bunge offer.
newsitem.headline: Defiance recommends accepting Bunge offer.

text.p: Defiance Food Industries Ltd on Thursday recommended to preference shareholders that they accept Bunge Foods Queensland's offer of NZ$2.41 per share.

Defiance Foods also said that as of Wednesday, Goodman Fielder subsidiary Quality Bakers NZ had yet to file a further application to the Commerce Commission for clearance to purchase the New Zealand milling and baking assets of Defiance.

Goodman Fielder had applied for an extension of time to the contract, but indicated it might require amendments to the substance of the contract if the transaction were to proceed. "This is a matter of continuing discussion between the parties," Defiance said.
"The result is that while the sale transaction contract remains current, it is not known whether the sale transaction will proceed and on what terms."

Defiance directors had decided that while the present uncertainty remained, they would postpone a shareholders' meeting to approve the sale transaction and the consequent constitutional changes previously proposed.
